field.description: A description of this firewall's physical location. (optional)
The amount of time, in seconds, before an interface is removed from ifTable after it has been deleted or removed (e.g. ppp, tun, etc. type temporary interfaces). (optional, default: 300)

field.sethelp: If an interface reappears before the Interface Fadeout expires, this option controls whether the record is replaced (checked) or if a new interface index will be given to the replacement interface (unchecked).

field.description:
The percentage of free space remaining before setting dskErrorFlag=1. Traps are not generated for disk usage. (optional, default: 20)
All detected disks except for /dev and its clones will be monitored by snmpd.

These fields configure Load Average monitoring in snmpd. When the load average is above the value configured for any interval, laErrorFlag is set to 1.

Traps are not generated for load average. When all fields are blank, Load Average Monitoring is disabled. To set a 5 minute value, the 1 minute value must also be set. To set a 15 minute value, the 5 and 1 minute values must also be set.

Extended Command entries allow custom user-defined programs to be executed by SNMP clients. This behavior is useful, but insecure and can potentially leak information. We recommend only using Extended Commands with SNMPv3 authorized users and transport encryption.
To access the output from clients, use the references found under nsExtendOutput1. For output with each line as a spearate OID, use nsExtendOutput2. 
snmpwalk -v 3 -l authPriv -a SHA -A 1234567890 -u myuser -x AES -X 1234567890 localhost nsExtendOutput1
To retrieve the output individually, use the configured extend Name as part of the OID: 
snmpget -v 3 -l authPriv -a SHA -A 1234567890 -u myuser -x AES -X 1234567890 localhost nsExtendOutputFull.\"uname\"
